data.title: The National Science and Technology Centre
data.meta_description: There’s something for every member of the family at Questacon. The kids will love getting hands-on with science in extraordinary ways.
data.text:
There’s something for every member of the family at Questacon. Travel from the centre of an Earthquake to the heart of a beehive, all the way to outer space!

You’ll find this zany metropolis of all things science and technology in the tourism hotspot of Canberra’s Parliamentary Zone, just a short walk from the city.

Questacon is open for pre-booked 2-hour timed sessions. Explore the world of science and technology through interactive exhibits. Experience exciting demonstrations and see a live Spectacular Science Show.

With safety for visitors and staff top priority, select galleries are open for set times each session. Signage in each gallery shows how to safely interact with the exhibits. Some exhibits can only be activated by staff and others can be used by visitors, with safety precautions in place.

Timed ticketed sessions run hourly from 9am each day, with the last session starting at 3pm. Questacon closes at 5pm daily (closed 25 December). Admission fees apply and tickets must be pre-booked online for all visitors, including babies and children. Ticket numbers are limited and are not available at the door.

The Questacon Shop offers a range of science-themed toys, gifts and souvenirs so you can continue the Questacon experience after you leave. Online shopping is also available year-round.

Mini Q and Excite@Q, including Free Fall, are currently closed.

Born or Built? Our Robotic Future examines the similarities and differences between humans and machines.

In the Fundamental gallery, explore classic science in exciting ways.

Experience the power and beauty of our planet in Awesome Earth, as you feel the force of an earthquake, watch a tornado form or let lightning spark your imagination.

Unleash your inner scientist with an array of intriguing experiments, engaging demonstrations and interesting displays at Q Lab. The Questacon Beehive is the new home for more than 10,000 of nature’s hardest workers and lets you see their busy and buzzy activity up close.

In the Mars gallery, gaze at Questacon’s 7-metre Mars globe and discover the landscape of the red planet.

No visit is complete without watching a Spectacular Science Show. These interactive shows will have you on the edge of your seat with their explosive experiments and entertaining characters.

For visitors aged 3-6 years and their carers, Questacon Science Sprouts is a new interactive early learning program. Running for 60 minutes, sessions include a mini show, role-play exercises and hands-on activities. Science Sprouts sessions are held from Wednesday to Saturday each week at 9:15am and 11:15am. Numbers are limited and pre-booked tickets are essential.
